tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE calibration_logs (
  log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
  calibration_date DATE NOT NULL,
  calibration_result FLOAT NOT NULL,
  technician_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE CalibrationLogs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  calibration_value FLOAT,
  calibration_notes VARCHAR(500),
  calibration_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE calibration_logs (
  log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
  calibration_date DATE NOT NULL,
  technician_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  calibration_result BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE sensors (
  sensor_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  manufacturer VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  purchase_date DATE NOT NULL,
  calibration_frequency INT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE technicians (
  technician_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  technician_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  technician_email VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  technician_phone VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE calibration_status (
  log_id INT NOT NULL,
  status_code INT NOT NULL,
  comments TEXT,
  CONSTRAINT fk_log_id FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES calibration_logs(log_id)
)

CREATE TABLE calibration_logs (
    log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
    calibration_date DATE NOT NULL,
    calibration_result BOOLEAN,
    notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE calibration_results (
    result_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT NOT NULL,
    procedure_id INT NOT NULL,
    technician_id INT NOT NULL,
    result BOOLEAN,
    notes TEXT
);
